thread.title: Clinton to meet with Black Lives Matter
thread.title_full: Clinton to meet with Black Lives Matter | Washington Examiner

author: Kelly Cohen
title: Clinton to meet with Black Lives Matter
text:
We meet with Hillary tomorrow AM. I'm looking forward to the convo & hopeful the convo will influence her platform. https://t.co/BYtKed6gJr — deray mckesson (@deray) October 8, 2015 
Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton will meet Friday with activists from the Black Lives Matter movement.
Deray McKesson, one of the top activists in the movement, confirmed the meeting on Twitter, and a Clinton campaign aide confirmed to NBC News that the meeting will take place Friday morning in Washington, D.C.
McKesson teamed up with other activists to release " Campaign Zero " in August, a policy agenda that stems from the Black Lives Matter movement. It seeks to end police violence nationwide.
  Paris train hero in critical condition after stabbing Airman 1st Class Spencer Stone was stabbed "repeatedly," according to a CBS news report.
By Jacqueline Klimas • 10/08/15 12:32 PM In late September, McKesson reached out to Clinton asking for a meeting. She replied, "Let's meet; we want to hear from anyone ready to address this urgent problem and work toward solutions. Our team will follow up."
The Black Lives Matter movement has sought to become a force in the 2016 elections, and activists have already interrupted numerous campaign events and pushed to meet with presidential candidates.
Top Story McCarthy out of speaker's race GOP was set to hold an internal election Thursday afternoon, but that election was postponed.
By Susan Ferrechio • 10/08/15 12:30 PM
